snippet: After a string of bankruptcies and failures, airline executives say that some of the savings from lower oil prices are being reinvested into their business.
abstract: Industry experts say growing business travel is keeping most passenger flights at full capacity, leaving little incentive for airlines to translate falling oil prices into lower airfares.
lead_paragraph: After a string of bankruptcies and failures, airline executives say that some of the savings from lower oil prices are being reinvested into their business.
